SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.codemonkey.swiftsocketclient
Class SwiftSocketClient

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.swiftsocketclient.SwiftSocketClient

public class SwiftSocketClient
extends Object

A low level message client that mediates messages from and to a server and the client in the form of 'datagrams' (custom serialized messages identified by a unique signature). See ServerMessageToClient for further details on these messages.

This class manages some client basics such as the client Socket, ClientType to create the client endpoint with, the host and port on which this server listens and the client state (stopped, stopping, running). This class also contains the lists of message types mapped to the unique identifiers known to both the client and server.

Furthermore, this class receives a new server connection and assigns a ServerHandler instance (see serverHandler). The server handler offers executable messages from the server back for the client to queue them and execute them sequentially (see serverMessages).

This server embodies the server listening function regardless of the type of client (UDP / TCP) in a uniform way. The differences between UDP and TCP are managed by the clientType. Everything that this client is used for can be done with either TCP or UDP without the user having to change anything. Just provide the right ClientType and the client changes without breaking API.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema

host

clientType

private final ClientType clientType

clientEndpoint

private ClientEndpoint clientEndpoint

serverMessageToClientTypeList

private final Map<Integer,Class<? extends ServerMessageToClient<?>>> serverMessageToClientTypeList
Used to identify a ServerMessageToClient type that can handle a binary packet.

executionContexts

private final Map<Class<? extends ServerMessageToClient<?>>,Object> executionContexts
Contains context objects mapped directly against a executable client message type. Usage of this list is optional.

This mechanism automates executing messages using a pre-registered context object. Client messages that are registered in this list will not be queued in the serverMessages queue for manual processing.

clientMessageToServerIdList

private final Map<Class<? extends ClientMessageToServer>,Integer> clientMessageToServerIdList
Used to prepend the right binary packet code for a given ClientMessageToServer type.

serverMessages

private final LinkedList<ServerMessageToClient<?>> serverMessages
A queue that contains unprocessed messages from the server.

serverHandler

private ServerHandler serverHandler
A server connection handler, for receiving ServerMessageToClient messages and sending ClientMessageToServer messages.

stopping

private boolean stopping
Constructor Detail

SwiftSocketClient

public SwiftSocketClient(String host,
                         int port)
Default constructor, calls SwiftSocketClient(String, int, ClientType) with TCP ClientType.

Parameters:
host - The host address on which to start listening.
port - The port on which to start listening.

SwiftSocketClient

public SwiftSocketClient(String host,
                         int port,
                         ClientType clientType)
Creates a swift socket client and registers a couple of basic message types (message invalid, pingpong and byebye).
  • Message invalid: sent to the server when a message code was not recognized
  • Pong message: sent when a Ping message was received from the server
  • ByeBye message: sent to signal the server the client has been closed (gracefully disconnecting instead of just dropping the connection)

Parameters:
host - The host address on which to start listening.
port - The port on which to start listening.
clientType - The ClientType strategy used to communicate.
Method Detail

registerClientMessageToServerType

public void registerClientMessageToServerType(int messageId,
                                              Class<? extends ClientMessageToServer> messageType)
Registers a client-to-server message on the given unique identifier. Both the client and server must use the same identifier to be able to decode the message on the server.

Parameters:
messageId - The unique identifier for this message type.
messageType - A ClientMessageToServer sub type.

registerServerMessageToClientType

public void registerServerMessageToClientType(int messageId,
                                              Class<? extends ServerMessageToClient<?>> messageType)
Registers a server-to-client message on the given unique identifier. Both the client and server must use the same identifier to be able to decode the message on the client.

Parameters:
messageId - The unique identifier for this message type.
messageType - A ServerMessageToClient sub type.

registerExecutionContext

public void registerExecutionContext(Class<? extends ServerMessageToClient<?>> messageType,
                                     Object executionContext)
Registers a default execution context for a server-to-client message type. Incoming messages of the given type are not queued in serverMessages, but executed directly using the registered execution context. This way the user doesn't have to manually process these executable client messages.

Parameters:
messageType - The type of message that will be matched and executed using the given context object.
executionContext - The execution context object used to execute executable client messages against.

start

public void start()
Thread safe method that starts the client thread, listening for new messages and sending messages.

See Also:
SwiftSocketClient.InvisibleClientRunner

hasServerResponses

public boolean hasServerResponses()
Whether there are unprocessed server messages waiting in queue to be executed.

Returns:
Whether serverMessages contains any entries.

getNextServerResponse

public ServerMessageToClient<?> getNextServerResponse()
Returns the queue's next unprocessed server message to be executed.

Returns:
The first entry of serverMessages using LinkedList.poll().

handleMessages

private void handleMessages(ClientEndpoint clientEndpoint)
                     throws IOException
Listens for a server to appear on the server endpoint. Creates a new ServerHandler for the ServerEndpoint.

Parameters:
clientEndpoint - The client endpoint on which we expect server messages.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown by ClientEndpoint.getServerEndpoint().

addServerResponse

protected void addServerResponse(ServerMessageToClient<?> message)
Adds a message to the queue for later processing, unless a known context object has been registered for this object in executionContexts.

Parameters:
message - The message to be executed now if registered with executionContexts, or later manually.

getServerMessageToClientType

protected Class<? extends ServerMessageToClient<?>> getServerMessageToClientType(int messageId)
Parameters:
messageId - The message id for which to find the registered message type.
Returns:

Parameters:

stop

public void stop()
Thread safe method to make the client initialize stopping procedure. This means sending a ClientMessageToServerByeBye, while closing the client socket simultaneously.

shutdown

private void shutdown()

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
Returns:
Whether the server is not stopping.

Whether we have an active connection to the server.

Cleans up the server handler in case the connection was dropped.
